    • Method Detail

      • flushLeftText

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> flushLeftText(java.lang.String text,
                                                             int LINEWIDTH)
        Format the specified text (a sequence of characters) into a list of lines where no line is longer than the specified line width. The output has to satisfy the constraints described below. In the description, the following definitions apply:
        • "whitespace" refers to any character that is "non printable", specifically for which Character.isWhitespace() returns true. For this assignment, you should only consider space, tab, and new line whitespace characters.
        • "printable" refers to any character that it not a whitespace character
        • "word" refers to a sequence of adjacent printable characters.
        • "line" refers to one entry in the output.
        Constraints
        1. Every printable character in the specified text must appear in one of the output lines.
        2. All printable characters in the specified text that are adjacent to each other must be adjacent and in the same order in the output lines subject to hyphenation (as described below)
        3. Any pair of printable characters in the specified text separated only by whitespace will either be separated by a space character in one of the output lines, or be in adjacent lines
        4. No line has more than LINEWIDTH characters in it.
        5. No line begins or ends with a whitespace character.
        6. The only whitespace character in any line is the space character (so all other whitespace characters are replaced with spaces or removed).
        7. There are no adjacent space characters (i.e. at most 1 space in a row, extra space characters are removed)
        8. If a word is longer than LINEWIDTH, it may be hyphenated (add '-') provided there is not already a hypthen in the word. If there is one or more hyphens, then the word is split at the hyphen closest to the line width. If there are no hyphens, then a hyphen can be added as the last character on the line and the rest of the word is moved to the next line (and hyphenated if necessary)
        9. If one or more newline characters ('\n') are in the input, then the line must end with the printable character immediately before it. If there is no such printable character then the newline is just removed.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to format.
        LINEWIDTH - The maximum width of a line.
        Returns:
        A list of strings of minimum size satisfying the constraints above.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - with the message "Constraints cannot be satisfied" if the constraints cannot be met for the specified input
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - with the message "Invalid text (null)" if the text is null;
